intro: Didelotia brevipaniculata, commonly known as the short-bracted didelotia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as a shrub with narrow, linear leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in dense clusters. Its botanical features include a branched stem and small, glandular hairs on the foliage. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils in arid or semi-arid regions.
